Reason for Rank: This is the top job position for me because I am getting my BS in Statistics, am looking into getting my MS in Statistics, and enjoyed my internship in the field. The disadvantages to this role is the required education and limited employment opportunities.

As a data science minor, I enjoy working with data and employing statistical analysis to leverage meaningful conclusions. This field is relatively new and growing, with a the entry-level education requirement being only a Bachelor's degree.
I really enjoy the kind of modeling operation research analysts employ, and it would be interesting to be able to provide data-driven consulting to a wide-range of customers.

In my experience as an intern for a government agency, I've come to appreciate and value information security measures and could see myself pursuing relevant certifications to better qualify myself for this role. The salary and job opportunities both appeal to me.
I find the work of an actuary to be interesting, however taking and passing the 7 acturial exams is an extensive committment.
The taskign of a market research analyst do not appeal to me as much as other types of analysts, however the the field has a lot of available jobs.

I could see myself chosing to become a management analyst later on in my career, but it can be hard to break into straight out of school and may involve working 40+ hours weekly, which makes finding a work-life balance harder.

While I enjoy building predictive models, I do not find financial data to be incredibly interesting, and the culture of finance is definitely a drawback for me. I hope to have work-life balance in my career.
